This seems like an issue with Maven build pulling down dependencies. Try close/reopen PR at a different time of the day when Travis is less busy...

Zeppelin by default includes `Welcome to Zeppelin` tutorial notebook, which is expected to be a part of the source tree\release as it is very convenient for a new users to have a reference point to start with.

Please make sure that this PR does not remove it.
Thanks for the information, I'll check it later today.

@echarles I tested this branch on my local machine but haven't deployed it to production yet. Since I deployed the workarounds I mentioned in [this](http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/incubator-zeppelin-users/201604.mbox/%3CCAMKL62nmLDJRghYB39MdnbAiRT6wvso0eVePKRtKurmu5iM%2BuQ%40mail.gmail.com%3E) email thread, I haven't seen the deadlock issue for more than two weeks. The long term fix is moving to jetty 9 and I think we should merge this pull request.

It would be better not to show `at undefined` in that case

2) `pdata.authenticationInfo.user` is not updated after running a paragraph

For example JIRA issue can provide additional information about the change, like 'fix version'. Also release note used to include list of JIRA issues, not Pullrequests.
Looks good to me.

@vijikarthi To enable dropdown selection, you need to click 'edit' button.
@Leemoonsoo I was trying to change the option in "edit" mode but still the selected item was not picked up by the list control.

Thoughts on multi-user support? - By extending this implementation, if we offer "per note process" for every user account ("isolated" per user session) and by passing the user identity (logged in user) to SPARK_SUBMIT command (SPARK_SUBMIT_OPTIONS="--proxy-user <USER>"), we could leverage the underlying "proxy" user support provided by the "spark-submit" doe that takes care of running the job (notes) in user context (yarn mode). This should work for both secure (kerberos) and insecure environment and it addresses multi-tenancy support (in addition to ZEPPELIN-773 which uses livy interpreter). The only caveat is the number of interpretor process increases as user base increases?

@vijikarthi I have pushed more commits with fix. Could you try it again?

Zeppelin already passes [AuthenticationInfo](https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/blob/master/zeppelin-interpreter/src/main/java/org/apache/zeppelin/user/AuthenticationInfo.java) to interpreter process through [InterpreterContext](https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/blob/master/zeppelin-interpreter/src/main/java/org/apache/zeppelin/interpreter/InterpreterContext.java#L52). I think Spark interpreter can use this information and set proxy-user programatically.
Now CI is green and ready to merge
When will this be in the main streamIt is a pity to see some great function missing while the solution is already available for more than half a year. Thanks.

@Leemoonsoo The latest commits seems to be working. I could see two different SC getting created in "isolated" mode. However when the second SparkContext is getting created, I am hitting an exception which is related to "SPARK-10872"

Regarding proxy user support, I am not sure if we can handle it inside "SparkInterpreter". The way spark-submit handles proxy-user is by running the main process itself as the proxy user (see https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/core/src/main/scala/org/apache/spark/deploy/SparkSubmit.scala#L160). In our case if we run the "RemoteInterpreterServer" as the proxy user, the rest of the flow is kind of taken care automatically. I have tested with/without Kerberos (by adding  SPARK_SUBMIT_OPTIONS="--proxy-user vijay -v" in bin/zeppelin-env.sh) and it works fine.
Thanks @rohannr for the improvement and test. LGTM

@vijikarthi Thanks for testing. 'SPARK-10872' is expected while default configuration of sparkcontext creates 'metastore_db' in the same location. If you configure hive-site.xml to use mysql or something else  for it's metastore, the errors will gone. Alternatively, you can set 'zeppelin.spark.useHiveContext' to 'false' in Interpreter menu, if you're not relying on HiveQL.

Regarding proxy user support, If passing "--proxy-user" argument in SPARK_SUBMIT_OPTIONS is the only way, Zeppelin needs extra mechanism to pass this argument. Thanks for sharing the details and user test result!
again
Based on the earlier comment, are we moving to #728 then?
Referee #765
Merging this

Won't affect #714 and #725

#6 and #761 are using jQuery Datatables
This PR is a proposal to use Handsontable instead of datatables. Handsontable is more like a spreadsheet and has good performance with many builtin [features](https://handsontable.com/features.html) and plugin support.

I've done a basic performance test with 20000x80 rows and columns data and few paragraphs with a subset.
PR #761 : https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B8L8gc9P-C-6eEhHeFVRd3cxNEE
PR #858 : https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B8L8gc9P-C-6dEo3OWVWa1J3QTQ

Great - will you have time to get that ready then?

```
_____________________________
```

We would need export to file feature which seems like is not supported in the free Handsontable version?
LGTM
@Leemoonsoo I've fixed the issue and rebased with master
@johnnyws Tested and working great. LGTM
Right, it is supported only in pro ver. Handsontable's Export feature is in front-end. IMHO export should be a backend feature and will be a good addition to our Notebook REST api.
Merge if there're no more discussions
